abstract: Policy makers need to start thinking about how to downsize institutions that are becoming “too big to fail” before the situation comes to that.
snippet: Policy makers need to start thinking about how to downsize institutions that are becoming “too big to fail” before the situation comes to that.
lead_paragraph: The financial crisis is forcing regulators to encourage the creation of bigger, more interconnected institutions. In the short term, this may serve a useful purpose by allowing healthier, well-capitalized banks like Wells Fargo, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase to shore up weaker ones.

headline.main: Too Many Banks ‘Too Big to Fail’
